I wonder why Major League Baseball is so much lower in their percentage of players of color than the rest of the sports?

ace_sentences: I notice a fact about professional sports.
For every professional sport, the number of players of color is higher than the number of coaches of color.
Soccer has the highest number of coaches of color among five sports.
Soccer has the second lowest percentage of players of color among five sports.
Major League Baseball is a professional sport.
The percentage of players of color in Major League Baseball is much lower than the percentage of players of color in other sports.
I wonder why the percentage of players of color in Major League Baseball is so low.
This situation has an impact on my community.
This situation may influence younger players.
Pressure can influence a younger player.
Expectations can influence a younger player.
If a younger player feels pressure, then the younger player may decide not to play a sport.
If a younger player has expectations, then the younger player may decide not to play a sport.
The headline is: Have professional sports ever been equal to all and will they ever be?
